What is the worst case runtime for Bubble Sort?
O(n^2)
O(n)
O(nlogn)
O(n^3)
What is the best case runtime for Bubble Sort?
O(n)
O(n^2)
O(nlogn)
O(n^3)
What is the space complexity for Bubble Sort?
O(1)
O(n^2)
O(n)
O(n^3)
What is the runtime for Selection Sort?
O(n^2)
O(n)
O(nlogn)
O(n^3)
What is the space complexity for Selection Sort?
O(1)
O(n)
O(n^2)
O(n^3)
What are the correct intermediate steps of the following data set when it is being sorted with the Selection sort? 15,20,10,18
10, 20,15,18 10,15,20,18 10,15,18,20
15,20,10,18 15,10,20,18 10,15,20,18 10,15,18,20
15,18,10,20 10,18,15,20 10,15,18,20 10,15,18,20
15,10,20,18 15,10,18,20 10,15,18,20
What is the runtime for Insertion Sort?
O(n^2)
O(n)
O(nlogn)
O(n^3)
What is the space complexity for Insertion Sort?
O(1)
O(n^2)
O(n)
O(n^3)
Consider the following lists of partially sorted numbers. The double bars represent the sort marker. How many comparisons and swaps are needed to sort the next number. [1 3 4 5 8 9 || 2]
6 comparisons, 5 swaps
5 comparisons, 4 swaps
4 comparisons, 5 swaps
5 comparisons, 6 swaps
What is the worst case runtime for Linear Search?
O(n)
O(n^2)
O(nlogn)
O(n^3)
Which of these would be considered the worst case scenario for a linear search?
The target value is not found in the list.
The target value is found at the beginning of the list.
The target value is found at the end of the list.
The target value is found somewhere in the middle of the list.
Consider the following list: { 9, 2, 6, 8, -3, 7, 2, 15, 0, -1, 14, 99, -1 }If a linear search for the value -1 is performed, what will be returned?
9
10
12
-1
